body.p:
Frankfort.
Capital Hotel March 28th
1 P. M. -- 1861.
To His Excellency --
Honbl B. McGoffin

Sir -- I have yr Communication through the Secretary of State recd within the hour and of present date, in brief reply stated that I do not feel assured that the supply of water at Cumberland for daily
consumption throughout the year, is adequqate to the necessities of a large Institution several hundred inmates -- And I respectfully urge on behalf of the unfortunate Patients who may come under treatment in the Western State Hospital that this supply essential to the succesful & have one conduct of the same be made certain before the Reconstruction of that edifice --
This is the only point I make in regard to this subject --
